results.expected: was written, were chosen, was crafted
results.actual: was written, were chosen, was crafted
results.poem:
The letter was written by candlelight dim,
With words that were chosen with trembling care,
Each sentence was crafted to reach out to him,
A message of love floating soft through the air.

results.expected: is done, was finished, is filled
results.actual: is done, was finished, is filled
results.poem:
The work is done, the day is complete,
The task was finished before the sun set,
My heart is filled with joy so sweet,
A goal achieved I won't forget.

results.expected: were taken, was lifted, were drawn, were stolen
results.actual: were taken, was lifted, were drawn, were stolen
results.poem:
The photographs were taken at dawn,
When mist was lifted by morning light,
The memories were drawn upon the lawn,
Before they were stolen by the night.

results.expected: been created, been given, been torn, been shown
results.actual: been created, been given, been torn, been shown
results.poem:
A world has been created from dreams,
Where hope has been given to all who seek,
The fabric of life has been torn at the seams,
Yet strength has been shown by the meek.

results.expected: get caught, get soaked, got broken, got restored
results.actual: get caught, get soaked, got broken, got restored
results.poem:
Don't get caught in the rain tonight,
Or you'll get soaked right to the bone,
The storm got broken by morning light,
And peace got restored when you came home.

I walked alone beneath the stars,
The moon shone bright above my head,
I dreamed of distant lands and cars,
And whispered softly what I said.

results.expected: are loved, are kissed, are blessed, am touched
results.actual: are loved, are kissed, are blessed, am touched
results.poem:
The flowers are loved by the bees,
The trees are kissed by morning dew,
The birds are blessed by gentle breeze,
And I am touched by thoughts of you.

I feel like I'm being watched tonight,
The shadows seem to move and sway,
My heart is being gripped by fright,
As darkness chases light away.

results.expected: very quickly ran, really slowly walked
results.actual: very quickly ran, really slowly walked
results.poem:
He very quickly ran away,
Through fields of gold at break of day,
She really slowly walked behind,
With thoughts of love upon her mind.

results.expected: extremely carefully stepped, quite nervously looked
results.actual: extremely carefully stepped, quite nervously looked
results.poem:
She extremely carefully stepped,
Across the ice where others slept,
He quite nervously looked around,
Not making even one small sound.

results.expected: very softly whispered, truly deeply felt, really gently touched, quite slowly walked
results.actual: very softly whispered, truly deeply felt, really gently touched, quite slowly walked
results.poem:
They very softly whispered low,
She truly deeply felt below,
He really gently touched her face,
And quite slowly walked with grace.

He quickly ran across the field,
The slowly setting sun revealed,
A gently flowing river wide,
Where softly singing birds reside.

results.expected: quickly ran, slowly walked, softly spoke, loudly laughed
results.actual: quickly ran, ran through, slowly walked, softly spoke, loudly laughed
results.poem:
He quickly ran through morning dew,
She slowly walked the path she knew,
They softly spoke of days gone by,
And loudly laughed beneath the sky.

results.expected: sang sweetly, flowed gently, blew fiercely, shone brightly
results.actual: sang sweetly, flowed gently, blew fiercely, shone brightly
results.poem:
The bird sang sweetly in the tree,
The river flowed gently to the sea,
The wind blew fiercely through the night,
The stars shone brightly with their light.

The ancient oak stood tall and proud,
Its branches reaching toward the cloud,
The forest deep held secrets old,
In whispered tales forever told.

Peter Piper picked a peck of pickled peppers,
A peck of pickled peppers Peter Piper picked,
If Peter Piper picked a peck of pickled peppers,
Where's the peck of pickled peppers Peter Piper picked?

Sally sells seashells by the seashore,
The shells she sells are seashells for sure,
So if she sells shells on the seashore,
I'm sure she sells seashore shells.

Big black bears browse by the brook,
Crafty cats catch curious creatures,
Dancing dolphins dive down deep,
Eager eagles eye their prey.

The brave boy bounded over the hill,
While fierce flames flickered in the night,
The gentle giant gave a gift,
To make the morning meadow bright.

The cat sat on a velvet chair,
While dogs played in the yard outside,
A bird flew over the quiet lake,
And fish swam in the river wide.

The knight knew nothing of the knife,
That knowledge kept him safe from strife,
The king kept kind words for the keen,
The kindest knight that he had seen.

The fleet feet sweep the street so clean,
While bees seek leaves upon the green,
We see the sea beneath the breeze,
And feel at ease among the trees.

I roam alone through roads unknown,
Where cold winds blow and groan and moan,
The snow falls slow on stones below,
And crows all know which way to go.

The cat sat flat upon the mat,
While bats attacked the rat so fat,
The man ran fast and grabbed his hat,
And that was that, imagine that!

The night light shines so bright and white,
While knights in flight take flight tonight,
The sky so high holds light sublime,
As time flies by in perfect rhyme.

I walk by night,
You rest in light,
We move through dawn,
Our path is drawn.

Shall I compare thee to a summer's day?
Thou art more lovely and more temperate.
Rough winds do shake the darling buds of May,
And summer's lease hath all too short a date.

Tell me not in mournful numbers,
Life is but an empty dream,
For the soul is dead that slumbers,
And things are not what they seem.

I wandered lonely as a cloud
That floats on high o'er vales and hills,
When all at once I saw a crowd,
A host of golden daffodils.

The cat quickly sat down on the extraordinarily soft mat
While birds magnificently sang their incredibly beautiful song
The dog enthusiastically ran through the wonderfully green grass
And butterflies gracefully flew past.

Her eyes shine like diamonds in the night,
Her smile spreads like sunshine warm and bright,
She moves like water flowing free,
And sings like birds in harmony.

He's as brave as a lion in the fight,
As swift as an eagle taking flight,
As gentle as a lamb at rest,
As wise as an owl, the very best.

The wind whispered secrets through the trees,
The sun smiled down upon the earth,
The moon danced across the midnight sky,
While shadows crept at evening's birth.

Life is a journey on a winding road,
The sun kissed the morning dew goodbye,
Her heart was as cold as winter's snow,
While time marched on beneath the sky.

I walked to the store today,
I bought some bread and milk,
I came back home another way,
My shirt was made of silk.

I walked alone beneath the stars,
The moon shone bright above my head,
I dreamed of distant lands and cars,
And whispered softly what I said.

I walk alone beneath the stars,
The moon shines bright above my head,
I dream of distant lands and cars,
And whisper softly what is said.

I walked alone beneath the stars,
The moon shines bright above my head,
I dreamed of distant lands and cars,
And whisper softly what is said.
(empty)
